Sec. 12. They shall enter in a book, to be kept
at the Main Police Station House, an account of
all property which may come into his possession
the name and residence of the owner, (if known,)
in whose possession it was found, and by whom ;
and whether the same was stolen or otherwise,
also how such property was disposed of.
Sec. 13. They shall keep a book, to be known
as a receipt for each and every article, whether
money or other property, taken from lodgers or
prisoners, and returned to them again, or deposited
with the Recorder's Clerks at the Recorder's Courts.
Sec. 14. They shall enter in a book, to be kept
at the Main Police Station House, all information
he may receive of offences committed, and of suspicious persons and places ; the entries made respecting offences committed, shall state the hour,
